definitions.definition: The intensity of the magnetic field which must be applied in order to reduce the magnetization of a ferromagnetic material to zero after the magnetization of the sample has been driven to saturation .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The quality of being coercive .
secondary_definitions: ( physics , materials science ) The intensity of the magnetic field which must be applied in order to reduce the magnetization of a ferromagnetic material to zero after the magnetization of the sample has been driven to saturation .
